sweat something ↔ out.translation[0].def: to wait anxiously for news that is very important to you
Charles is sweating it out while the coach decides which players he’s taking to the Olympics.
to work very hard on something, especially something difficult
They were sweating it out in the gym.
to get rid of an illness by making yourself sweat a lot
sweat something ↔ out.translation[1].def: to continue doing something that has been started, even though it is very difficult or worrying
Companies that have taken the plunge to the private sector must sweat out low returns in the hope that they can return to profit.
We had a slow start-up in the business, but we were determined tosweat it out.
